result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacey Rae Schafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond in the amount of $100.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance is to be  paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacey Rae Schafer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:10 PM: Defendant Lacey Rae Schafer in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve matter with GP.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  GP   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  DA argues as to SEH recommendations.  Spoke with Def prior to going of record today and made two offers on resolution.  Def requests to take advantage of PPDA offer.  Off Record for preparation of PPDA at 2:15.  Back of Record at 2:35 PM:  Per DA - PPDA has been reviewed and Def does not wish to accept same.  Def confirms same.  Court reaffirms previous plea and JOC.  No statement offered.  The Court:  Imposes Court Costs - Bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.
